availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James P. Kinkaid (Bath County, Kentucky, farmhand and corp 1st Reg Capital Guards, Bath Co Rangers)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel Kinkaid and Louisa Kinkaid. Farmhand in Bath County in 1860. Served in Captain Bussey’s Bath County Rangers as a corporal from December 11, 1863, to April 1, 1864. Served in the First Regiment Capital Guards, Frankfort Battalion (U.S.A.), as a corporal from February 1, 1864, to February 6, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 5A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 125.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 760, 887-88.
Find A Grave, “James Polk Kincaid (1843-1918)," Memorial # 70590301, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70590301/james-polk-kincaid (accessed January 25, 2021).
